intro: Pentacalia viburnifolia, commonly known as the Florida holly, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, white, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet. Its leaves are glossy and oval-shaped, providing a dense canopy, while its fruits are small, red drupes that persist through the winter. Pentacalia viburnifolia is often found in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in coastal areas.
